Standard pathway list

Standard pathway list

Link to standard content within the context of a page.

On this page
  • Visual design
  • Guidelines for use
  • Layouts
  • Examples and assets

Visual design

Design view:

Mobile design

Desktop designs can be viewed on screens wider than 650px.

Standard pathway

The standard pathway is an in-page link to another page on the site.

Variations

The default heading is H3 but it can also be H4. Refer to the typography guidelines.

CSS styles

Desktop

Title
h3 {
    color: #333333;
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
    font-size: 21px;
    line-height: 28px;
}
h3:hover {
    color: #254F90;
    text-decoration: underline;
}
Description
p.description {
    color: #333333;
    font-family: OpenSans;
    font-size: 16px;
    line-height: 28px;
    letter-spacing: 0.2px;
}
Icon link
.icon {    
    color: #254F90;
    height: 16px;
    width: 16px;
}
.icon:hover {
    color: #254F90;
    height: 32px;
    width: 32px;
}
Container
.container {
    background: #FFFFFF;
    padding: 24px;
    border-top: 4px solid #254F90;
    box-shadow: 0 0.125rem 0.75rem 0
    rgba(0,0,0,.2);
}

Mobile

Heading
h3 {    
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
    font-size: 21px;
    color: #333333;
    line-height: 30px;
    letter-spacing: 0;
}

Guidelines for use

Purpose: 

Generally used as a default option within index pages to link to a list of pages on the website.  

When to use this component: 

  • Used primarily for category or topic index pages. 
  • May also be used to show page hierarchy when a level that is lower than hero and higher than light pathways is required. 
  • Standard pathways may be used on content pages when linking to 3 or more internal links under the same heading. 
  • When used on content pages, the links should be for priority level 2 tasks or content.

Layouts

Page layouts

Standard pathway components are used in full width pages.

Component layout options

Equal widths layout

Desktop: Three equal width components in a row.

Tablet: Two equal width components in a row.

Mobile: One component in a row.

Examples and assets
